thread.title: Saints' 519 yards allowed among key stats in loss at Eagles
thread.title_full: Saints' 519 yards allowed among key stats in loss at Eagles | NOLA.com

author: Christopher Dabe, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Saints' 519 yards allowed among key stats in loss at Eagles
text:
The New Orleans Saints lost to the Philadelphia Eagles 39-17 on Sunday. The loss dropped the Saints to 1-4 on the season. Here's a look beyond the box score.
519 Total yards allowed by the Saints, the 11th highest total in team history. The Saints are 1-10 when they allow at least that many yards, with the only win coming last season against the Steelers. The Saints have surrendered 519 yards or more five times since 2012.
120 Scrimmage yards for DeMarco Murray, who averaged 1.6 rushing yards on 28 carries in his first three games with the Eagles. He rushed 20 times for 83 yards and a touchdown, and caught seven passes for 37 yards.
34 First downs allowed by the Saints, the second most in team history. The Saints surrendered 36 first downs in a win last season against the Steelers.
11 Catches for Willie Snead and Brandin Cooks, who both notched their first 100-yard receiving games. Snead caught six passes for 141 yards, and Cooks caught five for 107 with a touchdown as time expired.
5 Sacks of Drew Brees, marking the sixth time since he joined the Saints he has been taken down at least that many times. He has twice been sacked six times, in 2011 against the St. Louis Rams and 2013 against the Carolina Panthers. The Falcons sacked Brees five times last season at the Superdome.
